Chapters

Field tag

This tag represents an input field with an associated label.  It can be used in several ways.

Summary
Field tag
This tag represents an input field with an associated label.
Linked to a property
Most commonly, a field will be linked to a property to generate a caption/input control field in the form.
Linked to a property, custom controls
This is similar to a normal property link, but used when a more complex interface is required.
Custom values
For fields that have no linked property, the property attribute is absent.
Template placeholders

Linked to a property

Most commonly, a field will be linked to a property to generate a caption/input control field in the form.  In this method, two attributes must be specified: property and type.  Property holds the name of the property to link to, and type gives the input type used.  A default for the input can be given in an optional attribute default.  The field tag is empty in this use.

Linked to a property, custom controls

This is similar to a normal property link, but used when a more complex interface is required.  In this case, the type attribute is set to ‘custom’, and the content of the field tag may contain any HTML that is used to fill the input part.  The default attribute is not applicable in this case.

Custom values

For fields that have no linked property, the property attribute is absent.  Instead, two child tags of the field tag, <label> and <value> contain the HTML used to create the field.

Template placeholders

labelThe caption of the input.
valueThe HTML of the input itself.
